text: Michael Francis Land FRS (12 April 1942 - 14 December 2020)LAND, Prof. Michael Francis, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, 2014; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 was a British neurobiologist. He was a professor of neurobiology in the vision laboratory at the Sussex Centre for Neuroscience, University of Sussex, England. He was known for his visual information of the retinas of mosquitoes. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1998. Land died on 14 December 2020 at the age of 78.Land ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:British biologists Category:British neurologists Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:People from Sussex Category:University of Sussex
title: Michael F. Land
